summary: This document is an email chain from December 17, 2019, concerning a preservation request for video surveillance footage related to the Jeffrey Epstein incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 23, 2019. An attorney from Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP expresses surprise that the video was not retained and references a prior request made in July 2019.

persons.name: Esq. Barket
persons.context: Attorney from Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP who is making and following up on a preservation request for video footage related to the Epstein incident at MCC.

events.title: Epstein Incident at MCC
events.description: The incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center that is being investigated, believed to have occurred during the early morning hours.

events.title: Preservation Request Timeframe Start
events.description: The start of the timeframe for which video surveillance footage was requested to be preserved, from 11 PM on July 22 to 4 AM on July 23.

events.title: Follow-up on Preservation Request
events.description: An attorney follows up, expressing surprise that video footage was not retained despite a prior preservation request.

keyFacts: A formal preservation request was made for all video surveillance footage capturing the hallway outside Jeffrey Epstein's cell from July 22 at 11 PM to July 23 at 4 AM, 2019.
The attorney expresses surprise that the requested video footage was not retained, indicating a potential failure to preserve evidence related to Epstein's death.
It is noted that MCC staff do not wear body cameras, so no such footage exists of the incident's aftermath inside the cell.
The correspondence highlights legal efforts to secure evidence regarding the circumstances of Epstein's death while in federal custody.
